@ryanofsky   to make this constant time:

Change the conditional to use bit operations instead: 

fResult |= fsubNet.Match(ip) & (GetTime() < banEntry.nBanUntil)

Make the match constant time (which would probably involve similar transforms in it).

and

Replace the set with a vector with either a fixed number of entries or a size that is quantized to some interval. (E.g. multi

> Though I'm not sure why we really would care to hide the size of our banlist. :)\n\nThanks, I was just curious how you would go about something like this. I kind of figured the set lookup would have to change in some way, but I didn't think about the short circuiting operations at all. Interesting!
